lessons.title: Introduction to Kinematics
lessons.content: Kinematics is the branch of mechanics that describes the motion of objects without considering the forces that cause the motion.

lessons.title: Newton's Laws of Motion
lessons.content: Newton's three laws of motion form the foundation of classical mechanics.

lessons.title: Cell Structure
lessons.content: Understanding the basic components of prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.

questions.question_text: What is the SI unit of velocity?
questions.explanation: The SI unit of velocity is meters per second (m/s).

questions.question_text: State Newton's First Law of Motion.
options: An object at rest stays at rest unless acted upon by a force
Every action has an equal and opposite reaction
Energy cannot be created or destroyed
questions.correct_answer: An object at rest stays at rest unless acted upon by a force
questions.explanation: Newton's First Law states that an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by an external force.
